sn5.4:4.2: Then the nun Vijayā got dressed in the morning …
sn5.4:4.3: and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn5.4:4.4: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to make the nun Vijayā feel fear, terror, and goosebumps, wanting to make her fall away from convergence,
sn5.4:4.5: went up to her and addressed her in verse:
sn5.4:5.2: and I’m a youth in my prime.
sn5.4:5.3: Come, my lady, let us enjoy
sn5.4:5.4: the music of a five-piece band.”
sn5.4:6.2: “Who’s speaking this verse, a human or a non-human?”
sn5.4:6.4: “This is Māra the Wicked, wanting to make me feel fear, terror, and goosebumps, wanting to make me fall away from convergence!”
sn5.4:6.5: Then Vijayā, knowing that this was Māra the Wicked, replied to him in verse:
sn5.4:7.3: I hand them right back to you, Māra,
sn5.4:7.4: for I have no use for them.
sn5.4:8.3: I’m horrified and repelled by it,
sn5.4:9.1: There are beings in the realm of luminous form,
sn5.4:9.4: I’ve destroyed the darkness regarding all of them.”
sn5.4:10.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The nun Vijayā knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
